linkLabel: Marina di Praia och avskilda stränder
intro: Explore Marina di Praia and nearby coves for a change of pace from Positano's main beach.

sections.title: Marina di Praia essentials
body: Nestled between cliffs, this pebbly beach has sunbeds, kayak rentals, and seafood restaurants built into the rock.
Arrive before 10:30 to secure front-row loungers; afternoon shade creeps in after 16:00.

sections.title: Nearby coves
body: Rent a kayak to explore Grotta di Suppraiano or take a short boat transfer to secluded spots like Gavitella or Laurito.
Pack reef-friendly sunscreen and water shoes—the rocky seabed offers great snorkeling visibility.

sections.title: Getting there
body: Catch the SITA bus from Positano toward Amalfi; ask the driver for the Marina di Praia stop and walk down the ramp (five minutes).
Scooters can park at the top of the cove—bring coins for metered spots.

tips: Book lunch at Il Pirata or La Praia for cliffside dining between swims.
Carry a dry bag for valuables; beach space is compact and tidier when everything stays together.

a: There is a free section, but space is limited. Expect €20–€25 for a pair of sunbeds and an umbrella at beach clubs in peak season.
The walk takes roughly 50 minutes along the road with narrow shoulders. A bus or scooter is safer, especially in high season traffic.
